metadata.title: CVE-2022-48863 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:mISDN: Fix memory leak in dsp_pipeline_build()dsp_pipeline_build() allocates dup pointer by kstrdup(cfg),but then it updates dup variable by strsep(&dup, "|").As a result when it calls kfree(dup), the dup variable contains NULL.Found by Linux Driver Verification project (linuxtesting.org) with SVACE.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-48863` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-259-generic - 4.4.0-259.293
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-259-generic - 4.4.0-259.293
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-259-lowlatency - 4.4.0-259.293
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-229-generic - 4.15.0-229.241~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-229-generic - 4.15.0-229.241~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-229-lowlatency - 4.15.0-229.241~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1137-kvm - 4.4.0-1137.147
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1174-aws - 4.4.0-1174.189
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1173-aws - 4.15.0-1173.186~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1181-azure - 4.15.0-1181.196~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1166-gcp - 4.15.0-1166.183~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1135-oracle - 4.15.0-1135.146~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-259.293').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-229.241~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1137.147').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1174.189').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1173.186~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1181.196~16.04.1').
linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.4.0-1105.112').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1166.183~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1135.146~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
